column4: hi, does anybody know what is that web browser, it says mozilla but it is not firefox. I think i saw it on backtrack.
seamonkey?
vigo: i found that one, but it says it is "all-in-one application formerly known as the "Mozilla Application Suite"
right. remember Mozilla was a browser and it had an html editor and a mail client built in?
that became Seamonkey
file a bug
are you the one that i told to file a bug earlier today?
yeah.
you just have to wait for the bug to be fixed
i dont think it's a bug. By the way i read the rules for filling the bug, and i dont meet the requirements.
dont meet the requirements?
what do you mean you dont meet the requirements to file a bug?
you need to be able to reproduce condition, and some other stuff i read today.
does it consistently Not Work?
if so: reproducible
i think what they meant is, get working system, and hibernate again, if it doesn't work ... then file a bug. I will try to file a bug, and see what happens.
im a developer ;-) i know what they mean
because the hardware varies from system to system, trying it on some random other system and finding diffrent behaviour doesnt make it not-reproducible

if your installed system and a live cd behave the same, it verifies that its a bug and not "chetnick was screwing around and messed up the configuration" which makes it perfectly valid for you to file
there was a bug filled for sound not working after coming out of hibernation. But after reboot sound is back. My completly broke.
i dont care what /other/ bugs are filed. as i said, hardware varies.  what about *your* bug?
i filled a bug.
bug number?
